meeting_request.purpose: Help with deciding between graduate school and working in social justice or community organizing
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Lisa, a senior majoring in Sociology and Anthropology. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses lately, from social inequality to race and class, and I’ve really enjoyed exploring these topics. But now I’m starting to think about graduate school or working in a social justice organization, and I’m not sure which path would be best. I’ve been in a social justice class last semester, and it was really engaging, but I also had a lot of class participation and I’m not sure if I would be able to do that in a professional setting. I’m also interested in community organizing or social justice work, but I don’t know if that’s even a legitimate career path right now. I’m feeling really uncertain and overwhelmed, and I’m not sure if I should be taking classes or applying to graduate programs right now. I’d really appreciate help figuring out what I should do next.
